page.title: 01 INTRODUCTION
page.content: THE AREA JUST NORTH WEST OF STOCKTON IS CENTRED AROUND WYNYARD HALL AND ITS 6500 ACRE ESTATE OWNED BY LORD LONDONDERRY. THE ESTATE COVERS MOST OF THE AREA INCLUDING A LAKE AND SEVERAL SMALL WOODS. THE WOODS ARE MOSTLY DECIDUOUS EXCEPT FOR THE ODD SCATTERED COPSE OF CONIFEROUS TREES. THE AREA IS SPARSELY POPULATED, NO VILLAGES OR TOWNS ONLY THE OCCASIONAL FARMS. THE FARMING IS VIRTUALLY ALL ARABLE EXCEPT FOR A FEW SHEEP AND CATTLE. THE A689 RUNS THROUGH THE EAST OF THE AREA BUT APART FROM THAT, THERE IS A LACK OF ROADS. THERE ARE NO SHOPS, JUST THE ARANVALE PLANT NURSERIES. THE DISUSED CASTLE EDEN RAILWAY WHICH WAS OWNED BY THE NORTH EASTERN RAILWAY COMPANY WAS CLOSED DOWN IN 1966 AND THE TRACK PULLED UP IN 1979. IT IS NOW OWNED BY THE CLEVELAND COUNTY COUNCIL AND HAS BEEN MADE INTO A NATURE TRAIL. HEADING
